Posted 2015-11-24 , BBC News Link: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-34907609

Photo: Creative Commons

The United Nations is poised to grant Intangible Cultural Heritage status to the making of North Korean kimchi.

Unesco, the UN's cultural agency, has already bestowed the honour on the manufacture of the South Korean version of the pickled cabbage dish.

Given that it has described kimchi from both Koreas as "delicious",

"Koreans share experience among themselves to make delicious kimchi according to season, while helping each other with raw materials and in preparation,"
